United States, Colorado Governor announced on March 16 that "all DMV and Department of Revenue offices will be closed until April 18" effective March 17.
Policy Category: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

Event Description: United States, Colorado Governor announced on March 18 that the state Department of Public Health and Environment  has issued a public health order that goes into effect March 19 to "limit all mass gatherings to no more than 10 people for the next 30 days unless otherwise extended"
United States, Colorado Governor suspends all nonessential surgeries and medical procedures in order to free up equipment from March 23 to April 14
United States, Colorado Governor suspends all nonessential surgeries and medical procedures in order to free up equipment from March 23 to April 14. Extended until April 26.
United States, Colorado Governor Jared Polis ordered "non-essential businesses to reduce the number of people physically present in the workplace by 50 percent, and more if possible" March 22

United States, Colorado Governor issued a statewide "stay at home" order, requiring residents to avoid unnecessary travel or mingling with others outside their households. Beginning March 26 until April 11.

United States, Colorado "liquor stores and recreational marijuana shops deemed non-essential businesses" and forced to close March 23

United States, Colorado governor signs executive order D 2020 015 that authorises "certain state agencies to issue “emergency rules” extending the expiration dates of licenses and other documents because of coronaviurs. It aims to “limit in-person renewals and enable state agencies to better respond to COVID-19,”"
Policy Category: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

Event Description:
United States, Colorado Governor "ordering the temporary
suspension of certain statutes preventing county clerk and recorder offices from issuing marriage licenses when county clerk and recorder offices are closed to the public due to COVID-19. Extended until April 30. This extension will enable Coloradans to obtain marriage licenses while observing social distancing guidelines and minimizing the risk of spreading COVID-19."
Policy Category: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

Event Description: United States, Colorado Governor signs executive order to suspend the personal appearance requirement before notarial officers to perform notarizations for 30 days.
Policy Category: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

Event Description: United States, Colorado Department of Transportation suspended its Bustang and Outrider bus service for all routes throughout the state until at least April 11

United States, on April 1, Colorado Governor signed an Executive Order "expanding the use of telehealth services. This will increase the capacity of the state’s health care system, help preserve critical personal protective equipment needed for medical professionals on the front lines, and allow Coloradans to meet with a doctor remotely." Expires after 30 days unless extended.

United States, "Colorado securing medical supplies for coronavirus surge since feds can’t keep up, Governor Jared Polis says" April 1

United States, Colorado Governor "orders Hobby Lobby to close all stores in state after retailer defied stay-at-home directive" April 1
United States, Colorado Governor asks "all Colorado residents to wear non-medical cloth face masks when going out in public" April 3

United States, Colorado Department Public Health and the Environment announced "Due to the unique issues related to supply chain, financing, contract deadlines, and public need, construction may continue under Governor Polis’ stay-at-home order as long as Social Distancing Requirements are followed on construction worksites" "The state suggests reducing crew sizes and possibly deferring non-urgent work to reduce risks" April 3
United States, Colorado, Denver preparing to use Colorado Convention Center as a hospital beginning April 18.

Glenwood Springs, CO:  the Glenwood Springs City Council on April 6 voted to order all residents over the age of 2 to wear masks or face coverings while inside any place open to the public, and in outdoor spaces where 6-foot social distancing can’t be maintained. Penalties include fines up to $1,000 and up to a year in jail.

Initially, the Governor of Colorado, United States, declared a state of emergency March 10. But, the new Executive Order, which was introduced on April 8,  extended it expire thirty (30) days from April 8, 2020

United States, Colorado Governor "announced new online resources for Coloradans in the form of https://stayathomeco.colorado.gov/ which includes free resources to support Coloradans while they are at home, from wellness, to services, to education, to entertainment and more."

United States, Colorado Supreme Court Chief Justice Nathan Coats orders that "nearly all Colorado jury trials will be postponed until April and local courts are encouraged to postpone non-essential hearings or hold them by phone"
Policy Category: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

Event Description:
United States, Colorado Governor issues an Executive Order "temporarily suspends statute concerning bans on open burning to give boards of county commissioners broader discretion and more flexibility to implement
restrictions on open burning that will decrease the risk of fire and enable firefighters and other first responders to participate in the COVID-19 response efforts throughout the State." April 15

United States, Colorado Governor "signed an Executive Order today suspending certain regulatory statutes concerning juvenile justice, regional centers, and behavioral health to provide the Colorado Department of Human Services (CDHS) with flexibility to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic."
Policy Category: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

Event Description: The governor directed all P-12 schools to suspend normal in-person instruction from March 23, 2020 until the end of the scheduled 2019-2020 regular school year (May 29th). This Executive Order applies to all students and employees of P-12 schools in the State of Colorado, with the exception of those emergency or other critical personnel designated as essential, or whose presence is otherwise deemed necessary, by the appropriate school official.

Wheat Ridge, CO: The first mask mandate in the metro area went into effect April 27, with anyone entering a grocery store or other retail businesses in Wheat Ridge required to wear a non-medical face covering under an order from City Manager Patrick Goff. People who fail to comply can be charged with a misdemeanor, city officials said.The order runs through May 30

As of April 27,2020 in Aspen, CO: The Aspen City Council on April 27 adopted a public health order requiring masks or other cloth, non-medical face coverings be worn by anyone older than 2 inside all businesses and in any outdoor spaces where 6-foot social distancing isn’t possible.
